title: Franky Memorized the Pluton Blueprints
theoryText: Before burning the Pluton blueprints in episode 284, Franky had carried them for years and studied them extensively. Many fans theorize that Franky memorized the entire design and could potentially recreate the ancient weapon from memory if necessary. Given his genius as a shipwright and his intimate knowledge of the blueprints, it's plausible he retained the knowledge even after destroying the physical plans.
author: One Piece Fan Community

spoilerStatus.spoilerDescription: References future events and potential endgame scenarios

evidence: Franky studied the blueprints for years before burning them
He is a genius shipwright who apprenticed under Tom
He built the Thousand Sunny with advanced features
The blueprints were meant to counter Pluton if it was ever revived
counterEvidence: Franky's act of burning the blueprints was meant to be symbolic and final
Creating Pluton would go against the themes of trust and moving forward
No evidence in the story that Franky retained the knowledge

title: Franky Will Build Pluton in the Final War
theoryText: This theory expands on the memorization theory, suggesting that in the final war against the World Government, Franky will use his retained knowledge of the Pluton blueprints to either build a new Pluton or upgrade the Thousand Sunny with Pluton-level capabilities. This would provide the Straw Hats with the firepower needed to stand against the World Government's forces and potentially the original Pluton if it's ever recovered.
author: One Piece Theory Community

spoilerStatus.spoilerDescription: Speculates about final war and endgame scenarios

evidence: The Thousand Sunny already has advanced features suggesting Franky incorporated some knowledge
Franky's decision to burn the blueprints was based on betting on the Straw Hats
The final war will likely require powerful weapons
Thematic parallel: Tom worked on Roger's ship, Franky could build Luffy's ultimate vessel
counterEvidence: Would undermine the significance of burning the blueprints in episode 284
Contradicts the theme of trust over power
No canonical hints that Franky retained the knowledge

title: Thousand Sunny Contains Pluton Design Elements
theoryText: Some fans theorize that Franky incorporated elements of the Pluton design into the Thousand Sunny when he built it. This would explain some of the ship's advanced features and weapons systems. The theory suggests that while Franky didn't build a full ancient weapon, he may have used some of the innovative design principles he learned from studying the blueprints.
author: One Piece Fan Community

spoilerStatus.spoilerDescription: References the Thousand Sunny's construction and capabilities

popularity.metric: Very popular theory with mixed reception

evidence: The Thousand Sunny has advanced weapon systems like the Gaon Cannon
Franky studied the blueprints extensively before building the Sunny
Some design elements seem unusually advanced for a regular pirate ship
counterEvidence: Franky stated the Sunny was built with Adam Wood and his own designs
No canonical evidence supports Pluton elements in the Sunny
Most sources consider this theory to have 'no merit'
The Sunny's features can be explained by Franky's genius alone

title: Blackbeard Will Obtain the Original Pluton
theoryText: With the blueprints destroyed in episode 284, attention turns to the original Pluton ancient weapon. This theory suggests that Blackbeard will obtain the original Pluton, creating a scenario where the Straw Hats must face the ancient weapon without the counter-weapon that the blueprints could have provided. This raises the stakes of Franky's decision in episode 284.
author: One Piece Theory Community

spoilerStatus.spoilerDescription: Speculates about Blackbeard's endgame and ancient weapon locations

evidence: Blackbeard is collecting powerful abilities and weapons
He needs something to stand against the World Government
The original Pluton still exists somewhere in the world
Would create dramatic stakes for Franky's decision
counterEvidence: Location of original Pluton is still unknown in the story
Blackbeard's strategy focuses more on Devil Fruits than ancient weapons
Pure speculation with no canonical support yet

title: Franky's Decision Proves Robin's Trustworthiness
theoryText: Episode 284 represents a crucial character moment where Franky's decision to burn the blueprints serves as the ultimate validation of Robin's character. The theory emphasizes that Franky, who initially mistrusted Robin based on her reputation, came to understand her true nature. By destroying the only safeguard against Pluton, he demonstrates complete faith that Robin would never abuse ancient weapon knowledge, even under World Government torture.
author: One Piece Analysis Community

spoilerStatus.spoilerDescription: Focuses only on character development through episode 284

evidence: Franky explicitly tells Robin he misjudged her
His decision is based on understanding her character
Parallels Robin's own declaration to live in episode 278
Thematically supports the arc's message about trust and friendship
